original_title: Sri Lanka sells Rs.160 bn in T-bill auction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s Treasury bill yields fell across maturities at Wednesday’s auction while all offered 160 billion bills were sold, data from the state debt office showed.
The debt office accepted 59.9 billion rupees in 3-month bills at 25.65 percent, fell by one basis points from a week earlier, after offering 75 billion rupees.
31.9 billion rupees in 6-month bills were sold at 25.29 percent, fell by one basis points from a week earlier after offering 35 billion rupees.
68.1 billion rupees of 12-month bills were sold at 22.91 percent, fell by six basis points from a week earlier after offering 50 billion. (Colombo/May31/2023)
